==What to Check For==
Verify that sensitive data is not logged.
==Why==
If sensitive data is logged, it may be recovered by an attacker if the device is lost or compromised.
==How to Check==
To verify that sensitive data is not logged:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of types of sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Review logging code.** Identify code that generates log entries by searching for //NSLog()// function calls. Review this code to verify that it does not include sensitive information in log entries.
==How to Fix==
To prevent logging of sensitive data:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of types of sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Review logging code.** Identify code that generates log entries by searching for //NSLog()// function calls. Review this code to verify that it does not include sensitive information in log entries. If necessary, rewrite this code in a way that does not log sensitive data. If //NSLog()// calls are necessary for debugging, they can be conditionally commented out using //#define// directives.
==Privacy Guidelines== * [[Do Not Cache Sensitive Data]] * [[Do Not Log Location Data]] * [[Do Not Log Sensitive Data]]
